Record.ParentTerm: Abnormal Blood Chemistry and Hematology Test Result
Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Finding/Test Result/Laboratory Finding/Abnormal Laboratory Test Result/Abnormal Blood Chemistry and Hematology Test Result/Hypophosphatemia
Nutritional and Metabolic Diseases/Metabolic Diseases/Phosphorus Metabolism Disorders/Hypophosphatemia
Record.BroaderTerm: Abnormal Blood Chemistry and Hematology Test Result
Record.Description: A condition of an abnormally low level of PHOSPHATES in the blood. Severe hypophosphatemia (below 1 mg/liter) can affect every organ in the body leading to HEMOLYSIS; LASSITUDE; SEIZURES; and COMA. Chronic hypophosphatemia can lead to MUSCLE WEAKNESS; and bone diseases, such as RICKETS and OSTEOMALACIA.
Hypophosphatemia; lower than normal levels of phosphates in the circulating blood.
